snippet: The Phillies, who rigidly adhere to the modern definition of a closer, have not had a lot of use for Jonathan Papelbon of late and have fallen into last place.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column asserts that Philadelphia Phillies have little to show for their $50 million closer Johnathan Papelbon because manager Charlie Manuel rigidly adheres to the modern definition of a closer; notes that the Phillies are in last place, and have suffered seven walk-off defeats without using Papelbon in any of them.
lead_paragraph: The Phillies, who rigidly adhere to the modern definition of a closer, have not had a lot of use for Jonathan Papelbon of late and have fallen into last place.

headline.seo: Papelbon Warms Bench as Phillies Go Cold
headline.main: Prized Closer Warms the Bench as the Phillies Go Cold
headline.print_headline: Prized Closer Warms the Bench as the Phillies Go Cold
